title: Jeffrey Epstein wanted Robert Kraft to hire his lawyer amid Patriots owner’s prostitution case, documents show
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jeffrey Epstein advocated for Patriots owner Robert Kraft to hire his lawyer Jack Goldberger in 2019 prostitution case.
Documents show Epstein emailed about Kraft's case to legal and political contacts, including Brad Karp and Steve Bannon.
Kraft eventually hired Goldberger, and his solicitation charge was dropped in September 2020 after no arrest was made.

title: Porter Airlines is increasing service between Boston and Canada
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Porter Airlines to start direct, high-frequency flights from Boston to Montréal and Toronto starting May 14, 2026.
Logan Airport to offer seven weekly flights to Montréal and 14 weekly flights to Toronto with Porter Airlines.
Porter's fleet includes 78-seat Dash 8-400 and 132-seat Embraer E195-E2 with complimentary WiFi, snacks, and beverages.

title: Healey signs collaboration agreement with Denmark amid Greenland tensions
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Governor Maura Healey signed a collaboration agreement with Denmark, focusing on research, innovation, and business cooperation in Massachusetts.
The agreement was signed amid tensions over President Trump's proposal for U.S. control of Greenland, sparking protests in Denmark.
Denmark is a significant partner for Massachusetts, with $250 million in annual trade, and serves as the 16th-largest foreign investor in the U.S.

title: Traveling to Super Bowl LX? Here’s what to see and do in Santa Clara.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Levi's Stadium will host Super Bowl LX between the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks in Santa Clara.
Santa Clara offers cultural experiences including parks, free museums, a farmers market, and a self-guided culinary trail.
California's Great America amusement park in Santa Clara features Gold Striker, a renowned wooden rollercoaster with a 103-foot drop.

title: What Boston looked like in 2019 when the Patriots last won the Super Bowl
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: The New England Patriots celebrated their sixth Super Bowl win with a parade in Boston's Copley Square in February 2019.
In 2019, Boston was experiencing major events including Elizabeth Warren's presidential campaign launch and construction of the Encore Boston Harbor.
Boston faced icy conditions and a snowstorm shortly after the Patriots' victory in early February 2019.

title: Officer and civilian shot, suspect killed in Spencer
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Suspect Patrick Madison was killed after exchanging gunfire with police at a Family Dollar in Spencer on February 3, 2026.
A civilian was shot and injured by Madison before he barricaded himself in a Spencer store, local authorities confirm.
A Millbury police officer sustained injuries during the shootout and was hospitalized in stable condition, police reported.

title: Cape Cod house with Watergate ties falls victim to eroding bluff
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The Bartlett House in Eastham, linked to Watergate, is being demolished due to erosion on Coast Guard Beach.
Built in 1960, the Bartlett House was a vacation spot for Nixon's aides before becoming a public rental.
Demolition began on February 3, 2026, with plans to plant native vegetation on the former site.

title: UMass Lowell wants to make the city a destination with a new rink and hotel
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Lowell plans new ice rink and hotel to attract more visitors and boost local economy.
The Lowell Innovation Network Corridor aims to link innovation with community growth through collaboration with various partners.
Plans include expanding Tsongas Center's event capacity and reintroducing Lowell Spinners baseball team in 2026.

title: Judge drops assault charge against former City Hall staffer
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A judge dismissed domestic violence charges against former Boston City Hall staffer Chulan Huang due to the victim's absence in court.
The incident involved Huang's then-girlfriend Marwa Khudaynazar, who accused city official Segun Idowu of inappropriate behavior.
Khudaynazar's lawsuit against the city continues, though a judge dismissed most claims, allowing her First Amendment claim to proceed.

title: This Rowley inn is the perfect place for romance
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Briar Barn Inn in Rowley is highlighted as a top Valentine's Day getaway by The Hotel Guru.
JetBlue and Delta Air Lines are ranked among the safest airlines in 2026 by AirlineRatings.com.
Great Wolf Lodge offers a one-day flash sale on Feb. 6, with $26 per night stays through June 18.
